intro: Amblyopappus pauciflorus, commonly known as the sparse-flowered amblyopappus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, mat-forming shrub with hairy, narrow leaves adapted to reduce water loss. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by wind. Amblyopappus pauciflorus is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
